summary: This document is a compilation of daily lieutenant's logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, NY, for August 8, 2019. It details routine operations, inmate counts, and facility status throughout three shifts. The log notes an inmate being placed on suicide watch and another on psychological observation, and records inmate movements to court and the hospital. This is the day before Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.

persons.name: Lt.
persons.context: The lieutenant who assumed duties as the Morning Watch Operations Lieutenant at the beginning of the log, responsible for facility checks and counts.

persons.name: Lt.
persons.context: The lieutenant who relieved the previous shift and assumed duties as the Day Watch Operations Lieutenant.

persons.name: Lt. E/W
persons.context: The lieutenant who relieved the Day Watch lieutenant and assumed duties as the Evening Watch Operations Lieutenant.

persons.name: I/M Mace
persons.context: An inmate listed under 'Daily Sensitive Information' on the Evening Watch log as being on Suicide Watch.

events.title: Daily Correctional Center Operations
events.description: Routine daily operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, including multiple inmate counts, body alarm tests, equipment checks, and inmate movements to court and local hospitals.

events.title: Inmate Placed on Suicide Watch
events.description: An inmate identified as 'I/M Mace' was placed on suicide watch during the Evening Watch shift, as noted in the daily sensitive information.

events.title: Inmate Placed on Psychological Observation
events.description: An unspecified inmate was placed on psychological observation at 8:00 PM during the Evening Watch shift.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The logs document routine operations at the MCC New York on August 8, 2019, the day before Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell.
An inmate with the identifier 'I/M Mace' was placed on suicide watch during the Evening Watch shift.
Another inmate was placed on psychological observation later the same evening.
The logs show multiple inmate movements to court and a local hospital throughout the day.
The fire alarm and public address systems were reported as malfunctioning during the Day and Evening Watch shifts.
